items.title: 1. Previous flight training
items.notes: Document previous flight training experience

items.title: 2. Logbook Review
items.notes: Review student's existing logbook entries

items.title: 3. Contact information
items.notes: Verify all contact details are complete and accurate

items.title: 1. Safety Practices, Procedures and Equipment
items.notes: Understands hazards, door, seat, safety belt, and fire extinguisher operation

items.title: 2. Preflight Inspection, Flight Control and Systems Operation
items.notes: Observes preflight demo using checklist; understands switch & control functions

items.title: 3. Positive Exchange of Flight Controls
items.notes: Understands and uses the positive three-step exchange of controls

items.title: 4. Prestart checklist, Engine Starting and Warm-up
items.notes: Observes prestart checklist, starting and warm up procedures

items.title: 5. Taxiing
items.notes: Observes demo. With instructor, assists with controlling the airplane, observes signs and markings

items.title: 6. Before Takeoff Checks and Engine Runup
items.notes: Observes pretakeoff checklist and engine runup

items.title: 7. Normal Takeoff and Climb
items.notes: Observes & is lightly on the controls for instructor's takeoff & initial climb

items.title: 8. Level-off
items.notes: Observes and is lightly on the controls for instructor's level-off from initial climb

items.title: 9. Checklist Use
items.notes: Observes instructor use of checklists for all phases of flight

items.title: 10. Collision Avoidance
items.notes: Observes demo of clearing for traffic during climbs, descents, and before turns

items.title: 11. Trimming
items.notes: Senses the changes in control pressure and moves trim wheel in the correct direction

items.title: 12. Straight and Level
items.notes: Notes reference point and altitude changes and initiates corrections

items.title: 13. Demonstration of tendency to maintain straight and level flight
items.notes: Observes instructor demonstration of pitch and bank stability

items.title: 14. Turn Coordination
items.notes: With instructor assistance, applies rudder when starting & stopping turns

items.title: 15. Medium Bank Turns
items.notes: With assist starts & stops coordinated medium-bank, level altitude turn

items.title: 16. Climbs and Level-off
items.notes: Observes climb attitude and with instructor assist can establish a climb

items.title: 17. Descents and Level-off
items.notes: Observes descent attitude and with instructor assist can establish a descent

items.title: 18. Area Familiarization
items.notes: Observes as instructor directs attention to prominent landmarks and roadways

items.title: 19. Normal Approach and Landing
items.notes: Observes instructor normal approach and landing demo including checklist use

items.title: 20. After Landing, Taxi and Parking
items.notes: With instructor assist, completes after-landing checklist, taxi, shutdown & parking

items.title: 21. Post Flight Procedures
items.notes: Observes postflight inspection and securing demonstration while following checklist

items.title: 1. Preflight Inspection, Flight Control and Systems Operation
items.notes: With assist, performs preflight inspection with checklist & can explain systems operation

items.title: 2. Passenger Briefing
items.notes: Understands Hazards, Door, Seat, Safety belt, and fire extenguisher operation.

items.title: 3. Positive exchange of Flight Controls
items.notes: Understands and uses the positive three-step exchange of controls

items.title: 4. Engine Starting and Warm-up
items.notes: With instructor assist, completes prestart checklist, engine start & warm-up

items.title: 5. Radio Communications
items.notes: Turns on & sets up Comm radios copies ATIS, & makes taxi calls using a script

items.title: 6. Taxiing
items.notes: Taxies with minimal instructor assist, uses airport diagram, notes signs and markings

items.title: 7. Before Takeoff Checks and Engine Runup
items.notes: Completes pretakeoff checklist and engine runup with instructor assist

items.title: 8. Normal takeoff and climb
items.notes: Follows lightly on the controls during instructor's takeoff and initial climb

items.title: 9. Level Off
items.notes: With Instructor assist, levels off at desired altitude ± 300'

items.title: 10. Collision avoidance
items.notes: With instructor assist clears traffic during climbs, descents, and before turns

items.title: 11. Turn Coordination
items.notes: Applies aileron and appropriate rudder & elevator for turns both directions

items.title: 12. Medium Bank Turns
items.notes: Checks for traffic, starts a medium-bank turn holding ±200' and stops turn ±20 °

items.title: 13. Left and Right Turning Tendency
items.notes: Notes rudder required for lo speed/hi power & hi speed/lo power

items.title: 14. Trimming
items.notes: Applies trim in the correct direction removing control pressure

items.title: 15. Straight and Level
items.notes: Picks reference, maintains altitude ± 200' & heading within ±20°

items.title: 16. Climbs and Descents and Level-off With and Without Turns
items.notes: With assist, adjusts power, pitch & bank to hold ± 10 kts  & levels off  ± 200' & ±20°

items.title: 17. Descents With and Without Flaps
items.notes: With instructor assist, starts descent without flaps & extends flaps in increments. Note FPM changes with different flap settings

items.title: 18. Power Off Descent
items.notes: Notes attitude for best glide speed, makes turns, & adds power for level flight

items.title: 19. Traffic pattern operations
items.notes: Entry, Exit, and call outs. Observes as instructor directs attention to prominent landmarks and roadways

items.title: 20. Normal Approach and Landing
items.notes: Follows checklist & observes instructor demonstration of normal approach and landing

items.title: 21. After Landing, Taxi and Parking
items.notes: With minimal assist completes after landing checks, taxi using airport diagram and parking

items.title: 22. Postflight Procedures
items.notes: Completes postflight inspection and secures the aircraft using checklist

items.title: 1. Risk Management
items.notes: Reviews PAVE checklist with instructor noting fuel, weather conditions & loading

items.title: 2. Preflight Inspection, Startup, Taxiing, and Before Takeoff Checks
items.notes: With minimal assist, uses appropriate checklists & performs all ground operations

items.title: 3. Radio Communications
items.notes: With instructor assist & script, makes taxi, takeoff, & pre-landing calls

items.title: 4. Crosswind Taxi
items.notes: With minimal assist, notes wind, positons controls to counter the wind effects, uses diagram

items.title: 5. Normal Take Off and Climb
items.notes: With instructor's assist, performs normal takeoff, climbs ±10 kts, scans for traffic

items.title: 6. Straight and Level
items.notes: Notes reference point and altitude changes and initiates corrections, ±150' & ±15°

items.title: 7. Turns
items.notes: Starts and stops shallow & medium bank turns holding altitude ±150' rolling out  ±15°

items.title: 8. Climbs and Descents Straight and with Turns
items.notes: Grasps pitch/airspeed relationship holds ±10 kts, trims, & levels-off within ±100'

items.title: 9. Power Off Descent
items.notes: Attitude for best glide speed, 180° turns noting altitude loss, & level-off ±100'

items.title: 10. Aileron/Rudder Coordination Exercise
items.notes: Observes demo & then practices 30° bank side-to-side keeping nose on point

items.title: 11. Straight and Level Using Flight Instruments
items.notes: Using visual reference, S&L on instruments ±300' ±20° & compare with outside view

items.title: 12. Turns Using Flight Instruments
items.notes: Left & right med bank turns on instruments ±300' ±20° & compare with outside view

items.title: 13. Climbs and Descents Using Flight Instruments
items.notes: Initiates climbs and descents on instruments ±15° & compare with outside view

items.title: 14. Flying Slowly
items.notes: With assist, slows to 1.1xVS0 S&L, shallow turns, note changes in force, response & sound

items.title: 15. Descent at Approach Airspeed in Landing Configuration
items.notes: With minimal assist descends approach airspeeds/flaps to simulated landing at altitude

items.title: 16. Go-Around Procedures
items.notes: Observes demo & with assist does go-arounds at altitude (partial and full flaps)

items.title: 17. Area Recognition/Traffic Pattern Entry
items.notes: Correlates position with prominent local landmarks

items.title: 18. Normal Approach and Landing
items.notes: Follows lightly on the controls during instructor's normal approach and landing

items.title: 19. After Landing, Taxi, Parking, and Post Flight Procedures
items.notes: With minimal assist, uses appropriate checklists/diagrams & performs all ground operations

items.title: 1. Risk Managment
items.notes: Reviews PAVE checklist with instructor noting fuel, weather conditions & loading

items.title: 2. Stall/Spin Awareness
items.notes: Understands concept of aerodynamic stall & spin, warning signs & need to control yaw

items.title: 3. Preflight Inspection, Startup, Taxiing, and Before Takeoff Checks
items.notes: With minimal assist, uses appropriate checklists & performs all ground operations

items.title: 4. Crosswind Taxi
items.notes: With minimal assist, notes wind, positons controls to counter the wind effects, uses diagram. Demonstrate or verbal.

items.title: 5. Radio Communications
items.notes: With instructor assist & script, makes taxi, takeoff, & pre-landing calls

items.title: 6. Normal Take Off and Climb
items.notes: With instructor's assist, performs normal takeoff, climbs ±10 kts, scans for traffic

items.title: 7. Straight and Level
items.notes: Notes reference point and altitude changes and initiates corrections, ±150' & ±15°

items.title: 8. Turns
items.notes: Starts and stops shallow & medium bank turns holding altitude ±150' rolling out  ±15°

items.title: 9. Fundamental Maneuvers Visual Reference
items.notes: Uses coordinated controls, altitude ±150', heading ±15°, airspeed ±10 kts, bank ±10°

items.title: 10. Fundamental Maneuvers Instrument Reference
items.notes: Uses coordinated controls, altitude ±250', heading ±20°, airspeed ±10 kts, bank ±15°

items.title: 11. Flying Slowly
items.notes: With minimal assist, Straight&Level, turns, climbs, & descents at minimum airspeed

items.title: 12. Controlling Roll and Yaw at High Angle of Attack
items.notes: With instructor assistance, explores rudder use for bank control

items.title: 13. Power-Off Stall
items.notes: Observes demo and with assist, slows to a power-off stall & recovers at first indiction

items.title: 14. Power-Off Descent
items.notes: Demo of simulated emergency approach & landing, practice to no lower than 500' AGL

items.title: 15. Aileron/Rudder Coordination Exercise
items.notes: 30° bank side-to-side keeping nose within ±20° of point

items.title: 16. Go-Around Procedures
items.notes: Practice go-around procedures at altitude (partial and full flaps)

items.title: 17. Collision Avoidance
items.notes: Aware of high threat areas, scans for traffic in climbs & before turns & maneuvers

items.title: 18. Airport Traffic Pattern
items.notes: With instructor assist, complies with ATC instructions or non-tower procedures

items.title: 19. Normal and Crosswind Approach and Landing
items.notes: With instructor assist, completes checklist, configures airplane, flys approach to landing

items.title: 20. After Landing, Taxi, Parking, and Post Flight Procedures
items.notes: Uses appropriate checklists & performs all ground operations

items.title: 1. Risk Management and Decision Making
items.notes: Briefs the PAVE checklist and how it relates to decisions involving this flight

items.title: 2. Single Pilot Resource Management
items.notes: Reviews with instructor resources available to assist the pilot in flight

items.title: 3. Stall/Spin Awareness
items.notes: Can explain what a stall is, the warning signs, how to recover, & what causes a spin

items.title: 4. Preflight Inspection, Startup, Taxiing, and Before Takeoff Checks
items.notes: Uses appropriate checklists & performs all ground operations

items.title: 5. Radio Communications
items.notes: With minimal aids, makes all taxi, takeoff, & pre-landing calls

items.title: 6. Normal and Crosswind Take Off, Departure and Climb
items.notes: Tracks centerline, normal liftoff, conforms to departure, climbs ±5 kts, scans for traffic

items.title: 7. Fundamental Maneuvers Visual Reference
items.notes: Uses coordinated controls, altitude ±150', heading ±15°, airspeed ±10 kts, bank ±10°

items.title: 8. Crab
items.notes: Notes impact of crosswind on ground track & applies a crab angle to stay on  track

items.title: 9. Turns Around a Point
items.notes: Observes demo, notes wind, checks traffic, adjusts bank to correct for wind, ±200'

items.title: 10. Rectangular Course
items.notes: Notes wind, checks traffic, applies crab for crosswind, adjusts bank in turns, ±200'

items.title: 11. Sideslip
items.notes: Notes crosswind, uses sideslip to keep heading & track on ground course

items.title: 12. Forward Slip
items.notes: Uses slip to increase descent rate while keeping track aligned with ground reference

items.title: 13. Power-Off Stall
items.notes: Checks traffic, slows to a straight power-off stall & recovers at first indication

items.title: 14. Power-On Stall
items.notes: With assist, takeoff airspeed, adds power, pitches up, recovers at first indication

items.title: 15. Power-Off Descent
items.notes: Simulated emergency approach & landing to no lower than 500' AGL, ±15 kts

items.title: 16. Go-Around Procedures
items.notes: Practice go-around procedures at altitude (partial and full flaps), -50'

items.title: 17. Airport Traffic Pattern
items.notes: With minimal assist, complies with ATC instructions or non-tower procedures, ±150'

items.title: 18. Normal and Crosswind Approach and Landing
items.notes: With minimal assist, completes checklist, configures airplane, flies approach to landing

items.title: 19. After Landing, Taxi, Parking, and Post Flight Procedures
items.notes: Uses appropriate checklists & performs all ground operations

items.title: 1. Risk Management
items.notes: Briefs PAVE checklist flight risk factors and plan to mitigate them

items.title: 2. Situational Awareness
items.notes: Discusses methods of reorienting if temporarily lost in the local area

items.title: 3. Wake Turbulence Avoidance
items.notes: Explains procedures for taking off & landing after departing & arriving large aircraft

items.title: 4. Preflight Inspection, Startup, Taxiing, and Before Takeoff Checks
items.notes: Appropriate checklists, positions controls for X-wind & performs all ground operations

items.title: 5. Normal and Crosswind Take Off, Departure and Climb
items.notes: X-wind controls, tracks C/L, smooth liftoff, climbs +10/-5 kts, scans for traffic

items.title: 6. Blocked Pitot System or Static System
items.notes: Explains indications & procedures

items.title: 7. Primary Flight Display Failure
items.notes: Explains indications & procedures

items.title: 8. Electrical System Failure
items.notes: Explains indications & procedures

items.title: 9. Engine Failure (at Altitude) Simulated Landing
items.notes: Assesses situation, best glide ±10 kts, best field, memory items

items.title: 10. Engine Failure in Climb After Takeoff (at Altitude)
items.notes: Promptly pitches for best glide, ±10 kts, best field, memory items

items.title: 11. Emergency Descent
items.notes: Idle, clears area, 30-45° bank, radio call, max speed for configuration and conditions  +0/-10 kts

items.title: 12. Engine Fire
items.notes: Memory items, best glide ±10 kts, best field, emerg approach checklist

items.title: 13. Normal and Crosswind Approach and Landing
items.notes: Stabilized, +10/-5 kts, no drift, smooth touchdown, first 1/3, center 1/3

items.title: 14. Landing at Tower Controlled or Non-Tower Controlled Airport
items.notes: Traffic pattern procedures for the situation not yet experienced (if applicable)

items.title: 15. No Flap Landing
items.notes: Slip as necessary,  ±10 kts, no drift, smooth touchdown, first 1/3, center 1/3

items.title: 16. Go-Around
items.notes: Immediate takeoff power, pitch for Vy, +10/-5, flaps up, offset as appropriate. (Cram, Climb, Clean)

items.title: 17. Rejected Takeoff
items.notes: Set go/no-go point, idle, maximum braking, maintain directional control

items.title: 18. Forward Slip to Landing
items.notes: Low wing into wind, track aligned w/runway, smooth recovery to landing first 1/3

items.title: 19. After Landing, Taxi, Parking, and Post Flight Procedures
items.notes: Appropriate checklists, positions controls for X-wind & performs all ground operations

items.notes: Briefs stall characteristics & recovery procedure & spin recognition & recovery

items.title: 13. Straight and Level and Standard Rate Turns to a Heading (IR)
items.notes: Under control, coordinated, alt ±200', hdg ±15°, a/s ±10 kts, bank ±10°

items.title: 14. Airport Traffic Pattern
items.notes: Radio calls, complies with instructions and/or procedures, alt ±100'

items.title: 15. Normal Approach Landing (Full Stop)
items.notes: Min. 3 landings to full stop, stabilized, +10/-5 kts, lands center 1/3, landing attitude

items.title: 16. Go-Around Procedures
items.notes: Execute go-arounds from base, final, and start of flare with minimal altitude loss

items.notes: Appropriate checklists, positions controls for X-wind & performs all ground operations

items.notes: Departure, en route, destination & alternates (current & forecast), NOTAMS, what ifs for delays

items.title: 7. Destination/Alternates Facilities
items.notes: Briefs ATC or CTAF proced/freq, runways, taxiways, lighting, servicing, NavAids, NOTAMS

items.title: 8. CFIT
items.notes: Discusses night hazards on this route for Controlled Flight Into Terrain

items.title: 9. Night Preflight Inspection and Startup
items.notes: Correct/accurate steps w/checklists, uses good light, confirms required fuel load, preps cockpit

items.title: 10. Night Taxiing and Before Takeoff Checks
items.notes: Checks instruments and compass, controlled taxi using airport diagram, correct steps w/checklists

items.title: 11. Night Take Off and Climb
items.notes: Lights, on C/L, pwr & a/s check, climb attitude, positive climb, V Y  ±10 kts, wings level <400' AGL

items.title: 12. FSS and ATC Radar Service
items.notes: Files, opens & closes flight plan with FSS, employs VFR Flight Following (if available)

items.title: 13. Navigation (DR, Pilotage, VOR and GPS)
items.notes: Keeps nav log, uses DR, pilotage & electronic nav, track within 3 nm of course, ETA ±3 min

items.title: 14. Collision Avoidance
items.notes: Divides attention among all tasks making sure that looking for traffic is not abandoned

items.title: 15. Controlling by Flight Instruments (180° Turn and Electronic Navigation)
items.notes: Alt ±200', airspeed ±10 kts, standard rate turn bank ±10°, hdg ±15°, CDI 1/2 deflection

items.title: 16. Lost Procedures
items.notes: Instructor introduces realistic distractions requiring use of lost procedures for reorientation

items.title: 17. Diversion to an Alternate
items.notes: Scenario suggests diversion, picks suitable alternate, quick plans hdg, time, & fuel, advises ATC

items.title: 18. Emergency Operations
items.notes: Simulated rough engine, electrical failure, heading indicator  failure, radio failure

items.title: 19. Night Approach and Landing
items.notes: Pattern alt ±100', hdg ±10°, stabilized approach, a/s +10/-5 kts, 6 full stop (2 landing light off)

items.title: 20. Night Go-Around
items.notes: Immediate takeoff power, pitch on AI for V Y , airspeed +10/-5 kts, flaps up per POH

items.title: 21. Night Taxiing, Parking, Securing and Post Flight Procedures
items.notes: Confirms position w/airport diagram, conscious of lights on other aircraft, uses checklists.

items.title: 1. Logbook and Certificate endorsements and Required documents
items.notes: Understands the required endorsements, student pilot privileges & specific instructor restrictions

items.title: 2. Route Briefing
items.notes: Briefs route, checkpoints, airspace, terrain, boundaries, cross-checks, altitudes, VORs, alternates

items.title: 3. Weather briefing
items.notes: Departure, en route, destination & alternates (current & forecast), NOTAMS, what ifs for delays

items.title: 4. Destination/Alternates Facilities
items.notes: Briefs ATC or CTAF procedures/frequencies, runways, taxiways, servicing, NavAids, NOTAMS

items.title: 5. Navigation Plan
items.notes: Briefs charts & pubs (current), methods of navigation, nav log, times, fuel reserves

items.title: 6. Risk Management
items.notes: Briefs the PAVE checklist and how to employ the CARE checklist en route

items.title: 7. Single Pilot Resource Management
items.notes: Briefs resources available for assistance in and outside the cockpit including en route weather

items.title: 8. Lost Procedures
items.notes: Briefs steps to follow if unsure of position

items.title: 9. Weight and Balance and Performance
items.notes: Briefs takeoff & landing W&B, takeoff & landing runway required, power settings & performance

items.title: 10. Emergency Equipment and Survival Gear
items.notes: Explains location and use of emergency equipment & its adequacy for this flight

items.title: 11. Emergency Operations
items.notes: Briefs what ifs of engine failure, engine fire, rough engine, electrical failure, NORDO

items.title: 12. FSS and ATC Radar Service
items.notes: Files, opens & closes  flight plan with FSS for each leg, employs VFR Flight Following (if available)

items.title: 13. Flight to Airport More Than 50 NM Straight Line Distance
items.notes: Full stop normal landing, refueling (as necessary), weather briefing, return to home airport

items.title: 14. After Landing, Taxi, Parking, Post Flight Procedures and Refueling
items.notes: Uses checklists, charts for unfamiliar taxi, ensures correct refueling, closes flight plan

items.title: 15. Postflight Navigation Log and Conditions Review
items.notes: Briefs instructor on planned versus actual GS, ETE, fuel used, track, airport operations & weather

items.title: 1. Risk Management
items.notes: Briefs PAVE checklist and CARE checklist focusing on preparedness for in-flight equipment failures

items.title: 2. Single Pilot Resource Management
items.notes: Briefs planned use of available resources during emergencies

items.title: 3. Preflight Inspection, Startup, Taxiing, and Before Takeoff Checks
items.notes: Briefs safety items, correct/accurate steps w/checklists, proper taxi speed & controls

items.title: 4. Short Field Takeoff, Climb and Departure
items.notes: No-go, config., liftoff a/s per POH/AFM, Vx ± 5 kts until obstacle cleared

items.title: 5. Soft Field Takeoff and Climb
items.notes: No-go, controls/config set, earliest liftoff, ground effect until Vx /Vy , ± 5 kts

items.title: 6. Rejected Takeoff
items.notes: Set go/no-go point, idle, maximum braking, maintain directional control

items.title: 7. Engine Failure in Climb After Takeoff
items.notes: Promptly pitches for best glide, ±10 kts, best field, memory items

items.title: 8. Engine Fire in Flight, Emergency Descent and Landing (Simulated)
items.notes: Fire memory items, emerg descent config, best glide ±10 kts, best field, emerg approach checklist

items.title: 9. Constant Airspeed Climb IR
items.notes: Stabilized, coordinated, Vy ±5 kts,  hdg ±10°, level off alt ±100'

items.title: 10. Constant Airspeed Descent IR
items.notes: Stabilized, coordinated, a/s ±5 kts,  hdg ±10°, level off alt ±100'

items.title: 180° Level Turn IR
items.notes: Stabilized, coordinated,  alt ±150', airspeed ±10 kts, standard rate turn bank ±5°, hdg ±10°

items.title: 12. Electronic Navigation IR
items.notes: Tunes, selects course, alt ±150', airspeed ±10 kts, hdg ±10°, CDI 1/2 deflection

items.title: 13. Recovery from Unusual Attitudes IR
items.notes: Promptly to stabilized, level flight, coordinated, correct control sequence

items.title: 14. Autopilot (if installed) IR
items.notes: Preflight test, in simulated IMC engages wing leveling, alt & heading/nav hold to return to VMC

items.title: 15. Electrical Failure
items.notes: Simulated emergency, reverts to DR & pilotage, decides go to destination, alternate, or return

items.title: 16. Emergency Communications and ATC Resources
items.notes: Explain emergency communication procedures for requesting ATC assistance

items.title: 17. Short Field Approach and Landing
items.notes: Stabilized approach ±5 kts, touchdown within 400', stops in shortest distance

items.title: 18. Soft Field Approach and Landing
items.notes: Stabilized approach ±5 kts, touches down softly, wt. off nose, maintains crosswind correction

items.title: 19. No Flap Landing
items.notes: Slip as necessary, ±10 kts, no drift, smooth touchdown, first 500'

items.title: 20. After Landing, Taxi, Parking, and Post Flight Procedures
items.notes: Uses checklists, complete/accurate

items.title: 1. Valid Student Pilot Certificate, Sport Pilot Certificate, or Recreational Pilot Certificate.
2. Completion of flight training program.
items.notes: Flight training program to meet the requirements of part 61 sub part E. The rule provides the specific minimum aeronautical knowledge, flight proficiency and aeronautic experience requirements that the training program must meet.

items.title: 3. Night Experience Requirements.
items.notes: Applicants must meet night experience requirements regardless of medical qualification considerations. Section 61.110 lists the only exception.

items.title: 4. 3 hours of flight solely by reference to instruments.
items.notes: Private pilot airplane and powered lift applicants must also accomplish three hours of flight training on the control and maneuvering of the aircraft solely by reference to instruments in the category and class of aircraft. The three hours of flight training do not have to be conducted by a CF-II.

checklists.name: C3-L3: Endorsements
checklists.phase: Stage 3: Preparing for Commercial Pilot Check Ride

items.title: 1. Risk Managment
items.notes: Using PAVE checklist, brief risk factors for this flight & how to mitigate them

items.title: 2. Single Pilot Resource Managment
items.notes: Explains resources available for assistance during this flight

items.title: 3. Aircraft Perfomance and Weight and Balance
items.notes: Briefs takeoff and landing runway required, climb rate, and dual and solo weight & balance.

items.title: 4. Preflight Inspection, Startup, Taxiing, and Before Takeoff Checks
items.notes: Briefs Safety Items, Correct Accurate Steps with Checklists, Proper Taxi Speed and Controls

items.title: 5. Radio Communications
items.notes: Makes all appropriate calls, understands or requests clarification for instructions.

items.title: 6. Collision Avoidance
items.notes: Clears traffic before all operations on the ground and airborne.

items.title: 7. Normal and Crosswind Takeoff, Departure and Climb
items.notes: X-wind controls, tracks C/L, smooth liftoff, climbs +10/-5 kts, scans for traffic

items.title: 8. Pilotage to Practice Area
items.notes: Navigates the most suitable route to practice area using chart and landmarks.

items.title: 9. Ground Reference Maneuvers
items.notes: Checks for traffic & Obstructions, alt ±150', corrects for wind in straight & turning flight.

items.title: 10. Airport Traffic Pattern
items.notes: Appropriate radio calls complies with instructions and/or procedures. Altitude +/- 100'.

items.title: 11. Normal Approach and Landing
items.notes: Stabilized, +10/-5 kts, no drift, smooth touchdown, first 1/3, center 1/3

items.title: 12. Go-Around
items.notes: Immediate takeoff power, pitch for Vy, +10/-5, Flaps up, offset as appropriate. (Cram clean climb).

items.title: 13. Logbook and Certificate Endorsements
items.notes: Instructor makes appropriate entries and explains limitations.

items.title: 14. Radio Communications (Solo)
items.notes: Makes all appropriate calls, understands, or requests clarification for instructions.

items.title: 15. Airport Ground and Taxi Operations (Solo)
items.notes: Radio calls complies with instructions and/or procedures.

items.title: 16. Normal Takeoff, Climb to Ramin in Pattern (Solo)
items.notes: Radio calls, complies with instructions and/or procedures, Altitude ±100'.

items.title: 17. Airport Traffic Pattern (Solo)
items.notes: Appropriate radio calls complies with instructions and/or procedures Altitude ±100'

items.title: 18. Normal Approach and Landing (Solo)
items.notes: 3 landings to full stop.

items.title: 19. After Landing, Taxi, Parking, and Post Flight Procedures
items.notes: All operations correct & accurate w/checklists, taxi proper speed & controls.

checklists.name: I1-L1: Pre-flight and Basic Instrument Control

items.title: 1. Managing Risk for Instrument Flight
items.notes: Review & explain the PAVE checklist with emphasis on environmental conditions

items.title: 2. Positive Exchange of Flight Controls
items.notes: Understands and uses the positive three-step exchange of controls

items.title: 3. Collision Avoidance Procedures
items.notes: Clear understanding of responsibilities & procedures for visual & Instrument reference

items.title: 4. Using the Checklists
items.notes: Exercises an effective flow and check process for procedures

items.title: 5. Preflight for Instrument Flight
items.notes: Perform aircraft inspection with emphasis on systems associated with instrument flight

items.title: 6. Checking the Instruments on the Ground
items.notes: Systematically checks instruments & systems for proper indications during ground operations

items.title: 7. Runway Incursion Avoidance
items.notes: Uses airport diagram, notes taxi clearances, requests clarification as needed

items.title: 8. Normal Takeoff and Climb
items.notes: Completes pre-takeoff checks, checks HI on runway, notes airspeed indications on takeoff roll

items.title: 9. Constant Airspeed Climbs
items.notes: Smooth transition level to climb, maintains airspeed ±15kts, heading ±15°, bank ±10°

items.title: 10. Level-Off from Climb
items.notes: Smooth transition climb to level ±100 ft, accelerates to cruise airspeed, trims

items.title: 11. Straight and Level
items.notes: Maintains airspeed ±15kts, heading ±15°, altitude ±150 ft

items.title: 12. Level Standard Rate Turns to Heading
items.notes: Maintains ±15kts, target bank angle ±5°, stops on assigned heading ±10°, ±150 ft

items.title: 13. Constant Airspeed Descents
items.notes: Smooth transition level to descent, maintains airspeed ±15kts, heading ±15°, bank ±10°

items.title: 14. Level-Off from Descent
items.notes: Smooth transition descent to level ±100 ft, returns to cruise airspeed, trims

items.title: 15. Normal Approach and Landing
items.notes: Completes pre-landing checks, smooth landing with appropriate crosswind correction

items.title: 16. After landing, Taxi, Parking
items.notes: Exercises good practices to avoid runway incursions

items.title: 17. Postflight Procedures
items.notes: Notes equipment operation, conducts postflight inspection, documents discrepancies

items.notes: Reviews situational awareness issues with RNAV (GPS) and VOR systems

items.notes: Briefs charted minimum altitudes and hazards of off-airway routes

items.title: 4. Automation Management
items.notes: Review autopilot use for instrument flight

items.notes: Conducts complete preflight, taxi, pretakeoff checks with emphasis on instrument flight

items.notes: Review certification level, capabilities & limitations of installed GPS equipment

items.notes: Position with GPS, selects appropriate course/altitude to specified route or waypoint

items.title: 10. GPS Course Interception and Tracking
items.notes: Altitude ±150 ft, airspeed ±10 kts, intercepts and tracks course < full-scale deflection

items.notes: Determines & selects VOR frequency, identifies station by comparing audio code with chart

items.title: 9. NDB Bearing Interception and Tracking

items.notes: Maintains airspeed ±10 kts, heading ±10°, bank ±10°, levels ± 100 ft

items.title: 13. Straight and Level Using Standby/Partial-Panel Instruments
items.notes: Maintains ±150 ft, heading ±15°, airspeed ±10kts

items.title: 14. Standard Rate Turns to Headings Standby/Partial-Panel Instruments
items.notes: Up to 180° of turn, maintains alt ±150 ft, airspeed ±10kts, heading ±15°

items.title: 15. Constant Airspeed Climbs and Descents Standby/Partial-Panel Instruments
items.notes: Maintains airspeed ±15 kts, heading ±15°, levels ±200 ft

items.title: 16. Timed Turns to Heading Using Magnetic Compass
items.notes: Maintains alt ±150 ft, airspeed ±10 kts, bank angle ±5°, heading ±20°

items.title: 17. Unusual Attitudes Recovery (Nose High/Low) Standby/Partial-Panel
items.notes: Returns to stabilized level flight within operating limitations or not entering unsafe conditions

items.title: 18. After landing, Taxi, Parking, Postflight
items.notes: Exercises good practices to avoid runway incursions, notes & documents discrepancies

checklists.name: I3-L1: ILS Approaches and Procedure Turns

items.title: 1. Managing Risk for Instrument Flight
items.notes: Employs PAVE checklist (Pilot, W&B, Performance, Reserves, Weather)

items.title: 2. Situational Awareness
items.notes: Briefs situational awareness issues with ILS approaches and published procedures

items.title: 3. Controlled Flight into Terrain Awareness
items.notes: Briefs climb requirements and minimum altitudes on published procedures

items.title: 4. Single Pilot Resource Management
items.notes: Briefs the resources available for single-pilot IFR operations

items.title: 5. Task Management
items.notes: Briefs priorities of aircraft control, navigation & communications

items.title: 6. Before Instrument Flight Ground Operations
items.notes: Conducts complete preflight, taxi, pretakeoff checks with emphasis on instrument flight

items.title: 7. ILS Approach Briefing
items.notes: Briefs ILS approach procedures, minimums, missed approach procedures, and decision heights

items.title: 8. ILS Approach Intercepting and Tracking
items.notes: Intercepts & tracks ILS localizer, alt ±100 ft, airspeed ±10 kts, ≤3/4CDI

items.title: 9. ILS Approach Glideslope Intercepting and Tracking
items.notes: Intercepts & tracks ILS glideslope, alt ±100 ft, airspeed ±10 kts, ≤3/4CDI

items.title: 10. ILS Approach Final Approach
items.notes: Maintains ILS localizer & glideslope, alt ±100 ft, airspeed ±10 kts, ≤3/4CDI

items.title: 11. ILS Approach Missed Approach
items.notes: Executes missed approach procedures, alt ±100 ft, airspeed ±10 kts, ≤3/4CDI

items.title: 12. Procedure Turn
items.notes: Executes procedure turn, alt ±100 ft, airspeed ±10 kts, heading ±10°, ≤3/4CDI

items.title: 13. ILS Approach Standby/Partial-Panel
items.notes: Intercepts & tracks ILS localizer, alt ±100 ft, airspeed ±10 kts, ≤3/4CDI

items.title: 14. After landing, Taxi, Parking, Postflight
items.notes: Exercises good practices to avoid runway incursions, notes & documents discrepancies

checklists.name: I3-L2: RNAV Approaches with Vertical Guidance

items.title: 1. Managing Risk for Instrument Flight
items.notes: Employs PAVE checklist (Pilot, W&B, Performance, Reserves, Weather)

items.title: 2. Single Pilot Resource Management
items.notes: Briefs the resources available for single-pilot IFR operations

items.title: 3. Task Management
items.notes: Briefs priorities of aircraft control, navigation & communications

items.title: 4. Situational Awareness and Controlled Flight into Terrain Awareness
items.notes: Briefs navigation systems, backups, minimum altitudes, local minimum safe altitude

items.title: 5. Checklist Use
items.notes: Briefs how will use checklists during instrument approaches and uses them

items.title: 6. Before Instrument Flight Ground Operations
items.notes: Conducts complete preflight, navigation, taxi, pretakeoff checks for instrument flight

items.title: 7. RNAV (GPS) Setup for Approach
items.notes: Confirms nav data, calls up & verifies correct procedure/waypoints, notes mode & minima

items.title: 8. Approach Briefing
items.notes: Procedure, NAVAID, runway, course, min altitude/visibility, missed approach, notes

items.title: 9. Terminal Area Arrival Procedure
items.notes: Conforms to published procedure, alt ±100 ft, airspeed ±10 kts, heading ±10°, ≤3/4CDI

items.title: 10. RNAV (GPS WAAS) Approach with Vertical Guidance
items.notes: Alt ±100 ft until FAF then +100/-0 ft, airspeed ±10 kts, heading ±10°, ≤3/4CDI

items.title: 11. ILS Approach
items.notes: Alt ±100 ft until FAF then +100/-0 ft, airspeed ±10 kts, heading ±10°, ≤3/4CDI

items.title: 12. Missed Approach Procedure
items.notes: Initiates at DA/DH if no visual reference, +100/-0 ft, a/s ±10 kts, hdg ±10°, ≤3/4CDI

items.title: 13. Transition to Landing from Straight-In Approach
items.notes: From DH/DA normal rate of descent, normal maneuvering, uses visual glideslope

items.title: 14. Intercepting and Tracking DME Arcs
items.notes: Alt ±100 ft, airspeed ±10 kts, headings ±5°, DME ±1 nm, ≤3/4CDI

items.title: 15. After landing, Taxi, Parking, Postflight
items.notes: Exercises good practices to avoid runway incursions, notes & documents discrepancies

items.title: 1.1 Preparation - Expectations
items.notes: Plan at least 90 minutes ground time and 2 hours flight time minimum

items.title: 1.2 Preparation - Regulatory Review
items.notes: Pilot reviewed: Instrument Procedures Handbook, Instrument Flying Handbook, Aviation Weather and Weather Services

items.title: 1.3 Preparation - Documents Brought
items.notes: Pilot brought: PTS, FAR/AIM, charts, A/FD, POH/AFM for aircraft

items.title: 1.4 Preparation - IPC Prep Course
items.notes: Pilot completed IPC Prep Course at faasafety.gov

items.title: 1.5 Preparation - Cross-Country Assignment
items.notes: Assigned representative IFR cross-country route with published approaches

items.title: 1.6 Preparation - Weather Briefing
items.notes: Standard weather briefing obtained for assigned route and date

items.title: 2.1 Ground Review - Weather Analysis
items.notes: METARs, TAFs, winds aloft, radar, freezing levels, personal minimums compliance

items.title: 2.2 Ground Review - Flight Planning
items.notes: Route selection, alternates, fuel planning, terrain avoidance, passenger planning

items.title: 2.3 Ground Review - Aircraft Systems
items.notes: Pitot-static, gyroscopic instruments, magnetic compass, electrical, navigation, communication

items.title: 2.4 Ground Review - Performance
items.notes: Takeoff distance, climb performance, cruise performance, landing distance

items.title: 2.5 Ground Review - Taxi/Takeoff/Departure
items.notes: Taxi procedures, takeoff procedures, departure procedures, obstacle clearance, communication

items.title: 2.6 Ground Review - En Route
items.notes: Navigation procedures, altitude selection, airspace compliance, weather avoidance, fuel management

items.title: 2.7 Ground Review - Arrival/Approach
items.notes: Arrival procedures, approach briefing, minimums, missed approach procedures, decision points

items.title: 2.8 Ground Review - Missed Approach
items.notes: Missed approach procedures, climb procedures, navigation after missed, communication

items.title: 3.1 Flight - Basic Attitude Instrument Flying
items.notes: Straight and level flight, standard rate turns, climbs and descents

items.title: 3.2 Flight - Unusual Attitudes
items.notes: Recovery from unusual attitudes, partial panel operations

items.title: 3.3 Flight - Systems Knowledge
items.notes: Pitot-static system, gyroscopic instruments, magnetic compass, electrical system

items.title: 3.4 Flight - Navigation Equipment
items.notes: Navigation equipment operation, autopilot systems, communication procedures

items.title: 3.5 Flight - Aeronautical Decision Making
items.notes: Weather decision making, risk management, emergency procedures

items.title: 4.1 Post-Flight - Performance Review
items.notes: Review pilot performance, identify areas for improvement

items.title: 4.2 Post-Flight - Strengths Identified
items.notes: Identify pilot strengths and areas of proficiency

items.title: 4.3 Post-Flight - Recommendations
items.notes: Provide recommendations for continued proficiency

items.title: 4.4 Post-Flight - Next Steps
items.notes: Discuss next steps and practice plan

items.title: 5.1 Practice Plan - Personal Minimums
items.notes: Develop weather minimums, wind limits, performance limits

items.title: 5.2 Practice Plan - Proficiency Goals
items.notes: Set monthly IFR hours, approaches, annual goals, cross-country flights

items.title: 5.3 Practice Plan - Training Plan
items.notes: Establish goals, timeline, instructor qualifications, additional training

items.title: 6.1 Risk Management - Perceive Hazards
items.notes: Identify pilot, aircraft, environment, and external pressure factors

items.title: 6.2 Risk Management - Process Risk
items.notes: Evaluate consequences, alternatives, reality, external pressures

items.title: 6.3 Risk Management - Perform
items.notes: Mitigate or eliminate risks, make risk management decisions

items.title: 7.1 Weather - Big Picture Overview
items.notes: Review overall weather pattern and trends

items.title: 7.2 Weather - TAFs and METARs
items.notes: Analyze terminal aerodrome forecasts and meteorological reports

items.title: 7.3 Weather - Winds and Temps Aloft
items.notes: Review winds and temperatures aloft for route planning

items.title: 7.4 Weather - Radar and Freezing Levels
items.notes: Check radar returns and freezing level information

items.title: 7.5 Weather - Personal Minimums Compliance
items.notes: Verify weather meets established personal minimums

items.title: 7.6 Weather - Flight Service Briefing
items.notes: Obtain standard briefing from Flight Service or DUATS

items.title: 7.7 Weather - IFR Flight Plan
items.notes: File IFR flight plan and verify information

items.notes: Consider mountains, bodies of water, and other terrain features

items.notes: Review seasonal weather characteristics and local knowledge

items.title: 8.3 Regional - Local Factors
items.notes: Apply local knowledge and regional weather patterns

items.notes: Document certificate level, ratings, and endorsements

items.notes: Set goals for lowering personal minimums and IFR/IMC frequency

items.notes: Develop comprehensive aeronautical training plan

1. Pre-solo aeronautical knowledge 61.87(b)
items.notes: I certify that (first, middle, last) has satisfactorily completed the pre-solo knowledge test of 61.87(b) for the [make and model] aircraft.

items.title: 2. Pre-solo flight training 61.87(c)(1)(2) and 61.87(d)
items.notes: I certify that (first, middle, last) has received and logged pre-solo flight training for, the maneuvers and procedures that are appropriate to make the [make and model] aircraft. I have determined that (he or she) has demonstrated satisfactory proficiency and safety on the maneuvers and procedures required by 61.87 in this or similar make and model of aircraft to be flown.

items.title: 3. Solo flight 61.87(n)
items.notes: I certify that (first, middle, last) has received the required training to qualify for solo flying. I have determined that he or she meets the applicable requirements of 61.87(n) and is proficient to make solo flights in the (make and model).

items.title: 4. Solo flight at night 61.87(o)
items.notes: I certify that (first, middle, last) has received the required training to qualify for solo flight at night. I have determined that he or she meets the applicable requirements of 61.87(o) and is proficient to make solo flights at night in the (make and model).
